org.javaconfig.api

Interface Aggregate

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Configuration, FreezedConfiguration, FreezedConfigurationNode

    public interface Aggregate
    An aggregate is a ordered combination of Scope instances.
    Author:
    Anatole Tresch

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the unique name of a aggregate scope.
      java.util.List<Scope> getScopes()
      Return the scopes aggregated in this instance, in the order of precedence (the first are the weekest).
      boolean isContextual()
      Method allows to determine if a scope is contextual.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the unique name of a aggregate scope.
        Returns:
        The aggregate scope's name, never null.

      • getScopes

        java.util.List<Scope> getScopes()
        Return the scopes aggregated in this instance, in the order of precedence (the first are the weekest).
        Returns:
        the ordered list of aggregated scopes, never null.

      • isContextual

        boolean isContextual()
        Method allows to determine if a scope is contextual. Configuration of contextual scopes are accessed whenever they are needed.
        Returns:
        true, if this scope is contextual.
